(Simplified: 罂)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 賏 indicates the sound; 缶 (pottery) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • 賏 [ yīng ] necklace; pearls or shells strung together
    • 缶 [ fǒu ] earthen crock or jar; pottery
①(罌粟)二年生草本植物，全株有白粉，花有紅、紫、白等色，果實球形。未成熟時，果實中有白漿，是制鴉片的原料，果殼可入藥，花供觀賞。
②古代大腹小口的酒器。
罌粟 [ yīng sù ]: poppy
罌粟種子 [ yīng sù zhǒng zi ]: poppy seed

罌字的基本解释

罌
yīng
见“罂”。

罌字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yīng］
［《廣韻》烏莖切，平耕，影。］
亦作“甇1”。亦作“甖1”。“罂1”的繁体字。
(1)古代盛酒或水的瓦器，小口大腹，较缶为大。亦有木制者。
(2)泛指小口大腹的瓶。
(3)古代一种腹大口小的陶器。

罌字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【缶字部】　罌； 康熙笔画：20； 页码：页946第06
【廣韻】烏莖切【集韻】於莖切【韻會】幺莖切，?音纓。【說文】缶也。【廣雅】瓶也。【玉篇】瓦器也。【前漢·韓信傳】以木罌缶度軍，襲安邑。【註】師古曰：罌缶，謂瓶之大腹小口者也。　又【集韻】於正切，音郢。義同。【干祿字書】甖通罌。

Basic explanation of words
Poppy
yīng
See "Poppy".
Poppy
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yīng］
["Guangyun" black stems are cut, ploughed, and shadowed. ]
Also known as "甇1". Also known as "Poppy 1". Traditional characters for "Papaver 1".
(1) The ancient pottery used to hold wine or water has a small mouth and a big belly, which is larger than a fou. There are also wooden ones.
(2) Generally refers to a bottle with a small mouth and a big belly.
(3) An ancient pottery with a big belly and a small mouth.
Poppy
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Not concentrated] [Fou Character Department] 　 Yun; Kangxi Strokes: 20; Page Number: Page 946 06
[Guang Yun] Wu stem cut [Ji Yun] Cut at the stem [Yunhui] Unitary stem cut,? Yin Ying. [Said the text] Fou also. [Guang Ya] Bottle also. [Jade articles] Pottery also. [Previous Han·Han Xin Biography] Reaching Anyi with the Mu Ping Fou. [Note] Shi Gu said: "Poppy Fou" is also called the big belly and small mouth of the bottle.　[Jiyun] Yuzheng, Yin Yin. The same meaning. 【Qianlu Word Book】Poppy through poppy.
